summary: DEPRECATED: USE CrosscheckFingerprints. Checks if all read groups appear to come from the same individual.

arguments.summary: Allow the use of duplicate reads in performing the comparison. Can be useful when duplicate marking has been overly aggressive and coverage is low.
arguments.name: --ALLOW_DUPLICATE_READS

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Specificies which data-type should be used as the basic comparison unit. Fingerprints from readgroups can be "rolled-up" to the LIBRARY, SAMPLE, or FILE level before being compared. Fingerprints from VCF can be be compared by SAMPLE or FILE.
arguments.name: --CROSSCHECK_BY

arguments.summary: Instead of producing the normal comparison of read-groups, roll fingerprints up to the library level and print out a library x library matrix with LOD scores.
arguments.name: --CROSSCHECK_LIBRARIES

arguments.summary: Instead of producing the normal comparison of read-groups, roll fingerprints up to the sample level and print out a sample x sample matrix with LOD scores.
arguments.name: --CROSSCHECK_SAMPLES

arguments.summary: When one or more mismatches between groups is detected, exit with this value instead of 0.
arguments.name: --EXIT_CODE_WHEN_MISMATCH

arguments.summary: Expect all groups' fingerprints to match, irrespective of their sample names.  By default (with this value set to false), groups (readgroups, libraries, files, or samples) with different sample names are expected to mismatch, and those with the same sample name are expected to match.
arguments.name: --EXPECT_ALL_GROUPS_TO_MATCH

arguments.summary: Expect all read groups' fingerprints to match, irrespective of their sample names.  By default (with this value set to false), read groups with different sample names are expected to mismatch, and those with the same sample name are expected to match.
arguments.name: --EXPECT_ALL_READ_GROUPS_TO_MATCH

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: Assumed genotyping error rate that provides a floor on the probability that a genotype comes from the expected sample.
arguments.name: --GENOTYPING_ERROR_RATE

arguments.summary: The file lists a set of SNPs, optionally arranged in high-LD blocks, to be used for fingerprinting. See https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/documentation/article?id=9526 for details.
arguments.name: --HAPLOTYPE_MAP

arguments.summary: One or more input files (or lists of files) to compare fingerprints for.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary:
If any two groups (with the same sample name) match with a LOD score lower than the threshold the program will exit with a non-zero code to indicate error. Program will also exit with an error if it finds two groups with different sample name that match with a LOD score greater than -LOD_THRESHOLD.

LOD score 0 means equal likelihoodthat the groups match vs. come from different individuals, negative LOD scores mean N logs more likely that the groups are from different individuals, and positive numbers mean N logs more likely that the groups are from the sample individual.
arguments.name: --LOD_THRESHOLD

arguments.summary: The rate at which a heterozygous genotype in a normal sample turns into a homozygous (via loss of heterozygosity) in the tumor (model assumes independent events, so this needs to be larger than reality).
arguments.name: --LOSS_OF_HET_RATE

arguments.summary: Optional output file to write matrix of LOD scores to. This is less informative than the metrics output and only contains Normal-Normal LOD score (i.e. doesn't account for Loss of heterogeneity). It is however sometimes easier to use visually.
arguments.name: --MATRIX_OUTPUT

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The number of threads to use to process files and generate Fingerprints.
arguments.name: --NUM_THREADS

arguments.summary: Optional output file to write metrics to. Default is to write to stdout.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: If true then only groups that do not relate to each other as expected will have their LODs reported.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_ERRORS_ONLY

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: One or more input files (or lists of files) to compare fingerprints for. If this option is given the program compares each sample in INPUT with the sample from SECOND_INPUT that has the same sample ID. In addition, data will be grouped by SAMPLE regardless of the value of CROSSCHECK_BY. When operating in this mode, each sample in INPUT must also have a corresponding sample in SECOND_INPUT. If this is violated, the program will proceed to check the matching samples, but report the missing samples and return a non-zero error-code.
arguments.name: --SECOND_INPUT

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
Program to check that all read groups within the set of BAM files appear to come from the same
 individual.
name: CrosscheckReadGroupFingerprints
